message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CV, cs.NE 

The paper presents a learning-based approach to solving NP-hard problems using deep learning techniques and algorithmic elements from classic heuristics. The central component is a graph convolutional network, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also involves optimization and search algorithms, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-categories. The use of graph convolutional networks suggests that the paper could also belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves training neural networks, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
